DOC.brief_summary: In this study, the feasibility of optical imaging and FDG-PET in the evaluation of radiation-induced mucositis will be evaluated.
DOC.brief_title: A Feasibility Study on the Use of F-18-FDG-PET and Optical Imaging in Evaluation of Radiation-induced Oral Mucositis
DOC.criteria: Nonoperated histologically confirmed squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity, oropharynx (except the posterior wall) and lymph node metastases from the unknown primary tumor (CUP) Stage T14; Tx N+ for the CUP Multidisciplinary Group of Head and Neck Tumors at Ghent University Hospital decision of radical radiotherapy (±concurrent chemotherapy) Informed consent obtained, signed and dated before specific protocol procedures. Age < 18 years Pregnant or lactating women Active infection or fistula in the oral/oropharyngeal mucosa Previous cancer of the oral cavity and the oropharynx Prior headandneck radiotherapy Expectation of noncompliance with the study protocol Known allergy for topical anesthetics (Xylocaïne)
DOC.keyword: oropharynx and lymph node metastases from an unknown primary tumor
